title: Reporter's notebook: Haiti's at a breaking point but few want foreign intervention
description: The U.S. and other countries put sanctions on Haitian gangsters and a corrupt politician. But as Haiti combats hunger, cholera and gangs, many want Haitian solutions — not a foreign troop deployment.
content:encoded:
The U.S. and other countries put sanctions on Haitian gangsters and a corrupt politician. But as Haiti combats hunger, cholera and gangs, many want Haitian solutions — not a foreign troop deployment.

(Image credit: Odelyn Joseph for NPR)
dc:creator: Eyder Peralta
